summary: The Gambling Addiction Recovery, Investment, and Treatment Act (H.R. 1141) aims to address gambling addiction. It authorizes the Assistant Secretary for Mental Health and Substance Use to award formula grants to states to combat gambling addiction, based on existing substance abuse block grant allocation. It also allows the National Institute on Drug Abuse to award research grants. The Secretary of Health and Human Services is mandated to submit a report on the effectiveness of programs within three years. The bill authorizes appropriations for these activities, funded by a portion of federal gambling tax revenue.
